metadata.title: CVE-2017-11505 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The ReadOneJNGImage function in coders/png.c in ImageMagick through 6.9.9-0and 7.x through 7.0.6-1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (large loop and CPU consumption) via a malformed JNG file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.8').
